question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run() - Line 34-38] [Accumulator Proof Mismatch] Can transaction_accumulator proofs in ledger_update_output be inconsistent with the state_checkpoint Merkle proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Root Hash Manipulation] Can an attacker exploit timing between state_checkpoint and ledger_update calculations to inject different root hashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Transaction Reordering] Can execution_output.to_commit transactions be in different order than expected by base_view, causing incorrect state checkpoint indexing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Duplicate Transaction Detection] Does the workflow detect if execution_output contains duplicate transactions that could cause double-application of state updates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Replay Attack] Can an attacker replay old execution_output with outdated base_view to create PartialStateComputeResult that forks from current chain state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Gas Validation Bypass] Does the workflow validate that execution_output transaction gas amounts match the actual execution costs before embedding in TransactionInfo? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Gas Metering Inconsistency] Can DoLedgerUpdate use different gas amounts than what was computed during execution if execution_output is modified in-flight? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Reconfiguration Handling] If execution_output represents an epoch boundary with validator set changes, does the workflow properly handle next_epoch_state in state checkpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Epoch Transition Race] Can concurrent epoch transitions cause DoStateCheckpoint and DoLedgerUpdate to use different epoch states, breaking consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Hash Collision Exploitation] Can an attacker exploit hash collisions in state_checkpoint_hashes or transaction_info_hashes to create fraudulent state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Signature Verification Bypass] Does the workflow assume transactions in execution_output are already signature-verified? Can this assumption be violated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Auxiliary Info Manipulation] Can execution_output.persisted_auxiliary_infos be manipulated to corrupt TransactionInfo created by DoLedgerUpdate? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Event Hash Manipulation] Can execution_output.transaction_outputs contain manipulated event hashes that get embedded in TransactionInfo without validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Block Epilogue Validation] If execution_output contains block epilogue transactions, does the workflow validate they are properly positioned and formatted? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Hot State Operation Attack] Can block epilogue transactions contain malicious hot state operations that corrupt state checkpoints computed by DoStateCheckpoint? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Write Set Validation] Does DoStateCheckpoint validate that execution_output write sets don't contain duplicate keys or conflicting operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [State View Poisoning] Can execution_output.state_reads be manipulated to cause incorrect state_summary updates in DoStateCheckpoint? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Cached State Corruption] If execution_output was created with a corrupted state view cache, will DoStateCheckpoint detect and reject it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Status Validation] Does the workflow validate that all transactions in execution_output.to_commit have Keep status? Can Retry or Discard transactions slip through? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Failed Transaction Inclusion] Can execution_output include transactions with failed execution status that should not affect state checkpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/workflow/mod.rs] [Function: ApplyExecutionOutput::run()] [Partial Failure Handling] If set_state_checkpoint_output() succeeds but set_ledger_update_output() panics due to already being set, can this corrupt the PartialStateComputeResult? (High)
